text: Generally accepted indications for its use include: * Unstable angina o Acute left ventricular failure, usually with an EF of less than 30% * Acute mitral regurgitation Its use may also be considered in: * High risk patients undergoing percutaneous translumimal coronary angioplasty (PTCA) « Patients at high risk of cardiac decompensation undergoing non-cardiac surgery « Ventricular arrhythmias refractory to conventional treatment The use of a balloon pump is contraindicated in: * Aortic regurgitation * Aortic dissection * Severe aorto-iliac disease « Prosthetic aortic grafts
